body:
Comment 9: 
to original reporter:

pubkey auth works like this:

1. client offers all public keys to server, in a loop. server confirms whether it likes
any of the keys
2. client signs session ID for each accepted key until the server OKs.

the cache is only for caching result between #1. and #2. After the user is in, the auth
is never repeated, so the only way to effect a revocation is to kill an existing session.

What kind of scenario are you worried about implications of this cache?
